comment.author: 92987904@N00
comment._content: WINSLOW MAY LEAD FLEET'S CANAL TRIP; Officers Expect Head of First Division to Succeed Badger as Commander in Chief -- "Naval officers are of the opinion that when the Atlantic Fleet, with the famous Oregon leading the way, passes from ocean to ocean through the Panama Canal in the early part of 1915, thus marking the opening of the canal to the world's trade, the officer who will stand on the bridge of the superdreadnought Wyoming as Commander in Chief of the Fleet will be Rear Admiral Cameron McR. Winslow." New York Times, September 28, 1913 (How great is it having this online???)

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: We'll add the additional identification to the source data and reload the description. Thanks!
